revised_title: Henri Alexandre Deslandres: Pioneering Contributions to Astrophysics and Solar Physics
tldr: Henri Alexandre Deslandres was a French astronomer and astrophysicist who made significant contributions to the fields of spectroscopy, solar physics, and astrophysics. He is best known for his work on solar spectra, solar eclipses, and the development of innovative instruments like the spectro-enregistreur des vitesses and the spectroheliograph. Deslandres' research on the Sun's chromosphere and prominences, as well as his studies on the rotation of planets and the Sun's magnetic field, helped establish him as a leading figure in the astronomical world.
